required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DS-9231 in Intermediate-risk (Sub-massive) Acute Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Safety and Thrombolytic Effect of Ascending Doses of DS-9231 (TS23) in Subjects With Intermediate-risk (Sub-massive) Acute Pulmonary Embolism (PE)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate safety and initial effectiveness of DS-9231 when taken together with current standard of care. Evaluation will be done with low, medium and then high doses of DS-9231 versus placebo, in participants with medium-risk acute pulmonary embolism.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Ascending doses in sequential cohorts (1-3) will be evaluated against placebo

primary_outcome.measure: Percent change from baseline in total thrombus volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 48-96 hours after study drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with various gradations of decrease in total thrombus volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 48-96 hours after study drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with major or clinically relevant nonmajor bleeding
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 7 days after study drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent change from baseline in total thrombus volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with with various gradations of decrease in total thrombus volume
Percent change from baseline in RV/ left ventricle (LV) diameter ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 48-96 hours and 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with PE-related deaths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who died from any cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with clinical deterioration requiring additional rescue therapy for PE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with with recurrent, objectively documented venous thromboembolism (VTE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant-reported quality of life on a proprietary scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 30 after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with major or clinically relevant nonmajor bleeding
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants re-hospitalized for any reason
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with non-bleeding adverse events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with anti-drug antibodies (ADAs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after study drug administration
Baseline to 30 days after study drug administration

arm_group.description: In conjunction with standard of care, participants will receive an intravenous infusion delivering DS-9231 at ascending dose levels in Cohort 1, 2, and 3
In conjunction with standard of care, participants will receive an intravenous infusion delivering only saline solution as matching placebo comparator

intervention.description: DS-9231 in saline solution for intravenous infusion
Placebo is matching saline solution for intravenous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Had protocol-defined pulmonary embolism (PE)
- Has stable systolic blood pressure (SBP) >90 mm Hg
- Has evidence of right ventricular (RV) dysfunction
- Has executed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has history or plans for thrombotic therapy outside protocol allowance
- Has other contraindications for participation
- Has laboratory results outside protocol-specified limits
- Is pregnant, nursing, and/or not willing or able to use protocol-defined contraceptives
- Has history or condition, or participated in another investigational study that (per protocol or in the opinion of the investigator) might compromise:
1. the safety or well-being of the participant or the participant's offspring
2. the safety of study staff
3. the analysis of results

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
